column4: hi guys, i cant connect to my wired connection from my laptop running ubuntu hardy
can anyone help?
someone please, its a bit urgent
It helps to include the make and model of the hardware you are trying to troubleshoot
can you still help?
what network card does that use?
im not sure, how can i check?
Found it, reading up on that now
ok thanks very much. please let me know
any luck? any way I can find out what network card is inside?
I was reading through the laptop testing pages...
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/LaptopTestingTeam/AsusF3Ka       we the closest model I found and it had no ethernet issues..  use the link to asus to see if it has the same ethernet as yours.
on the asus site, it doesnt say the network card model name
i just found out by running lspci... the network card name is Ethernet controller: Attansic Technology Corp. L1 Gigabit Ethernet Adapter, and i have a Netgear WPN824v2 router
it looks as though you need to use  ndiswrapper for that
how do i determine if that is indeed the problem?
Still looking into the problem
ok no worries. thank you
http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-768100.html                   has some info, but that should be working
ok thanks, im reading it now. i'll let you know how it goes
sorry, but that isnt too helpful, as im looking for troubleshooting for my *wired* connection. wireless is fine!
